attributes.action: To have Fibromyalgia recognised more along with other mental health illnesses
attributes.additional_details: alot of places in northern ireland have lack of facilities, more mental health specialists are needed gp's should have a more understanding and not send patients home with leaflets
attributes.background: too much stigma around mental health illnesses such chronic disorders and manic disorders, too many people are treated like 2nd class citizens. more training is needed on mental health its not all about text book, more facilities is needed for chronic pain like fibromyalgia

rejection.details:
Petitions need to contain a clear request for something that you would like the UK Government or Parliament to do. 

Your petition also suggests that you would like action to be taken in Northern Ireland. Health policy in Northern Ireland is the responsibility of the Northern Ireland Assembly and the Northern Ireland Executive. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it. 

You might want to write to your local MLA (Member of the Legislative Assembly), who represents you in the Northern Ireland Assembly, about this issue. You can find your MLA, and how to contact them, here:
 
http://aims.niassembly.gov.uk/mlas/search.aspx
